author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: العَزِيزُ الْكَرِيمُ، ثُمَّ قَدِّرْ لِمَنْ أَقْبَلَ إِلَيْكَ ما يَجْعَلُهُ مُسْتَقِيمًا عَلَى أَمْرِكَ عَلَى شَأْنٍ لا تَحْجُبُهُ أَوْهامُ المُشْرِكينَ مِنْ خَلْقِكَ وَلا كَلِماتُ المُعْرِضِينَ مِنْ عِبادِكَ إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ المُهَيْمِنُ المُقْتَدِرُ القَدِيرُ.
translation: Do Thou ordain, moreover, for every one who hath turned towards Thee what will make him steadfast in Thy Cause, in such wise that neither the vain imaginations of the infidels among Thy creatures, nor the idle talk of the froward amidst Thy servants will have the power to shut him out from Thee. Thou, verily, art the Help in Peril, the Almighty, the Most Powerful.
